autoop.core.ml.model.classification package

Submodules

autoop.core.ml.model.classification.decision_tree_classification module

class autoop.core.ml.model.classification.decision_tree_classification.DecisionTreeClassification(max_depth: int = None)[source]

Bases: Model

A Decision Tree classifier model that recursively splits the dataset based on features to maximize the purity of each resulting node, creating a hierarchical structure for classification tasks.

Attributes: - model (DecisionTreeClassifier): The underlying scikit-learn Decision Tree classifier. - trained (bool): Boolean flag indicating if the model has been trained.

Methods: - fit(X, y): Trains the Decision Tree model on the provided dataset. - predict(X): Makes predictions on new data, given that the model is already trained.

fit(X: ndarray, y: ndarray) → None[source]

Train the Decision Tree Classification model.

Parameters:

  • X (np.ndarray): Feature matrix with shape (n_samples, n_features

). - y (np.ndarray): Target vector with shape (n_samples,).

Sets:

  • self.trained (bool): Marks the model as trained.

predict(X: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Make predictions using the trained model.

Parameters:

  • X (np.ndarray): Feature matrix with shape (n_samples,

n_features).

Returns:

  • np.ndarray: Array of predictions with shape (n_samples,).

Raises:

  • ValueError: If the model has not been trained yet.

autoop.core.ml.model.classification.knn module

class autoop.core.ml.model.classification.knn.KNearestNeighbors(n_neighbors: int = 3)[source]

Bases: Model

A K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) classifier model that uses the specified number of nearest neighbors to classify samples based on their proximity to labeled data.

Attributes: - n_neighbors (int): The number of neighbors to use for classification. - model (KNeighborsClassifier): The underlying scikit-learn KNN classifier. - trained (bool): Boolean flag indicating if the model has been trained.

Methods: - fit(X, y): Trains the KNN model on the provided dataset. - predict(X): Makes predictions on new data, given that the model is already trained.

fit(X: ndarray, y: ndarray) → None[source]

Train the K-Nearest Neighbors model.

Parameters: - X (np.ndarray): Feature matrix with shape (n_samples, n_features ). - y (np.ndarray): Target vector with shape (n_samples,).

Sets: - self.trained (bool): Marks the model as trained.

predict(X: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Make predictions using the trained model.

Parameters:

  • X (np.ndarray): Feature matrix with shape (n_samples,

n_features).

Returns:

  • np.ndarray: Array of predictions with shape (n_samples,).

Raises:

  • ValueError: If the model has not been trained yet.

Wrapper for logistic regression using scikit-learn’s implementation.

Train the logistic regression model.

Args:

X (np.ndarray): Feature matrix for training. y (np.ndarray): Target vector for training.

Returns:

None

Raises:

ValueError: If the model cannot be trained.

predict(X: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Make predictions using the trained model.

Args:

X (np.ndarray): Feature matrix for predictions.

Returns:

np.ndarray: Predicted class labels.

Raises:

ValueError: If the model is not trained before prediction.

Module contents

This package offers machine learning models for classification tasks.

Modules: - LogisticRegression: Implements logistic regression for binary classification. - KNearestNeighbors: A KNN classifier for multi-class classification. - DecisionTreeClassification: A decision tree-based classifier.

These modules can be imported for building, training, and using classifiers.

class autoop.core.ml.model.classification.DecisionTreeClassification(max_depth: int = None)[source]

Bases: Model

A Decision Tree classifier model that recursively splits the dataset based on features to maximize the purity of each resulting node, creating a hierarchical structure for classification tasks.

Attributes: - model (DecisionTreeClassifier): The underlying scikit-learn Decision Tree classifier. - trained (bool): Boolean flag indicating if the model has been trained.

Methods: - fit(X, y): Trains the Decision Tree model on the provided dataset. - predict(X): Makes predictions on new data, given that the model is already trained.

fit(X: ndarray, y: ndarray) → None[source]

Train the Decision Tree Classification model.

  • X (np.ndarray): Feature matrix with shape (n_samples, n_features

). - y (np.ndarray): Target vector with shape (n_samples,).

Sets:

  • self.trained (bool): Marks the model as trained.

Make predictions using the trained model.

n_features).

Returns:

class autoop.core.ml.model.classification.KNearestNeighbors(n_neighbors: int = 3)[source]

Bases: Model

A K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) classifier model that uses the specified number of nearest neighbors to classify samples based on their proximity to labeled data.

Attributes: - n_neighbors (int): The number of neighbors to use for classification. - model (KNeighborsClassifier): The underlying scikit-learn KNN classifier. - trained (bool): Boolean flag indicating if the model has been trained.

Methods: - fit(X, y): Trains the KNN model on the provided dataset. - predict(X): Makes predictions on new data, given that the model is already trained.

fit(X: ndarray, y: ndarray) → None[source]

Train the K-Nearest Neighbors model.

Sets: - self.trained (bool): Marks the model as trained.
